definitions.text: an architectural partition with a height and length greater than its thickness; used to divide or enclose an area or to support another structure
examples: the south wall had a small window
the walls were covered with pictures

definitions.text: anything that suggests a wall in structure or function or effect
examples: negotiations ran into a brick wall

definitions.text: (anatomy) a layer (a lining or membrane) that encloses a structure

examples: his back was to the wall
competition was pushing them to the wall

definitions.text: a vertical (or almost vertical) smooth rock face (as of a cave or mountain)
a layer of material that encloses space
examples: the walls of the cylinder were perforated

definitions.text: a masonry fence (as around an estate or garden)
examples: he ducked behind the garden wall and waited

definitions.text: an embankment built around a space for defensive purposes
examples: they stormed the ramparts of the city
they blew the trumpet and the walls came tumbling down

definitions.text: surround with a wall in order to fortify
